title: Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain left out of Liverpool squad after being struck on the head in training
text:
Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain was left out of Liverpool's matchday squad for their clash with Leicester after being struck on the head by a ball in training.

The 26-year-old star had received the blow at Melwood on Friday, and was left out of Jurgen Klopp's 18-man group as a precaution.

The Athletic's James Pearce described Oxlade-Chamberlain as 'feeling the effects' of the strike, and James Milner was instead selected in the centre of midfield at Anfield.

Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain missed out on Liverpool's clash with Leicester as a precaution

Everton's Theo Walcott had suffered from a similar incident in their defeat to Manchester City last weekend, and was again absent from the Toffees' squad to take on Burnley on Saturday.

However, Oxlade-Chamberlain is expected to return to action for Klopp's men shortly.

The former Arsenal midfielder has made five league appearances so far this season, but was left out of Gareth Southgate's latest England squad for the upcoming Euro 2020 qualifiers.

The star had been struck on the head by a ball in training on Friday and was left out by Klopp

The reigning European champions named 18-year-old Harvey Elliott on the bench, with Milner being awarded the captain's armband against former boss Brendan Rodger's side.

Liverpool also handed Sadio Mane his 100th Premier League start for the top flight giants.

Klopp's side were also looking to extend their 43-game unbeaten streak at Anfield.
description: The 26-year-old star had received the blow at Melwood on Friday, and was left out of Jurgen Klopp's 18-man group as a precaution.
